p: CoVs mainly cause respiratory and intestinal infections with an array of clinical manifestations. So far, 7 CoVs have been identified that produce infections in humans. These are the α-type HCoV-229E and HCoV-NL63; the β-type HCoV-HKU1, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV, and HCoV-OC43; and 2019-nCoV (that caused the present pandemic). HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63, and HCoV-HKU were mildly pathogenic; while SARS-CoV or Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome CoV, and MERS-CoV or Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus were highly pathogenic. The highly pathogenic CoVs infect the lower respiratory tract causing fatal acute lung injury (ALI) and acute respiratory disease syndrome (ARDS). We are yet to determine the severity of SARS-CoV2 (Abd El-Aziz and Stockand 2020).
